title: Assert non-writable property of reserved registers
body:
All instructions that writes data to a register must be shielded by the
assertion that the register is writable

title: Fix gas subtraction overflow
body:
As pointed by @mediremi , we might overflow on the post-execution gas
deduction.

That operation must be safe, so we have to use `checked_sub`

title: Bump to v0.14.0
body:
## What's Changed
* Add tests for `GTF` instruction by @vlopes11 in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-vm/pull/178
* Update fuel-tx to v0.17 by @vlopes11 in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-vm/pull/180


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-vm/compare/v0.13.0...v0.14.0

title: Update fuel-tx to v0.17
body:
This upgrade includes the tx pointer as part of the input structure, the
ability to perform predicate verification for input messages, and an API
to prepare transactions for either predicate verification or script
execution.

It also removes the `X**` instructions since they are supersede by `GTF`

title: Implement `GTF` instruction
body:
Implements the `GTF` instruction.

The tests are being developed in parallel. This PR is released so the accumulated breaking changes can be unblocked for `fuel-core`.

The tests are expected to be added only incrementally, so they can be released as patch (with eventual bugfixes, if applicable)

title: Implement GM::GetVerifyingPredicate metadata instr
body:
The context of the execution should contain more info such as the index
of the current predicate so we decouple that from the vm initialization.

Also, its worthy to create a type that will encapsulate the behavior of
the runtime predicates since it needs to store not only the program to
be executed - so it can't be represented just as a memory slice - but
the original input index that created the predicate.

The input index is not required for the predicate execution since the
program memory offset is a constant function of the consensus
parameters, but it might be consumed by the user - as in the specs.

title: Fix `Receipt::Call`s having the wrong `id`
body:
When a script calls a contract, a Call receipt is appended. If I'm reading [the spec](https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-specs/blob/master/specs/vm/instruction_set.md#call-call-contract) correctly, in such a case, the call receipt's `to` field should be the called contract's ID, and the `from` field should be `0x0000...`, indicating that it was called from the script.

We were putting the contract's ID on both `to` and `from` fields and this PR aims to fix that.

The issue was:
- To initiate the call, we modify `REG_FP`.
- When creating the receipt, we check `self.registers[REG_FP] == 0` to see if the call is external.
- This gives an unexpected result because `REG_FP` was modified.

The fix is basically reading the value for the `from` field before `REG_FP` gets modified.

title: Allow cgas to fall below requested forward amount
body:
When decrementing the cgas before making a contract call, we took the `min(forward_amount, current_global_gas)`. This meant that once cgas was less than the forward amount, an error would occur. 

This PR fixes the behavior to make cgas decrement using `min(forward_amount, current_context_gas)`. This ensures cgas will still allow calls to occur when less than the max forward amount.

title: Fix CGAS overflow bug
body:
I'm not sure if this is actually the correct approach, so please review carefully.

Also fortifies some gas arithmetics using `checked_*` methods, as per our discussion with @Voxelot.

title: Feat: Use in-memory binary Merkle tree
body:
- Updates `fuel-merkle` to 0.3.0
- Uses in-memory Merkle tree when calculating `ephemeral_merkle_root`

title: patch release 0.12.1 for tx maturity fixes
body:
releases non-breaking fixes for tx maturity:

- https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-vm/pull/154
- https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-vm/pull/160

title: Disable faulty predicate checks during create tx execution
body:
disable duplicative predicate verification checks when submitting create txs. Predicate verification should be executed by the client / txpool, not when a tx is run by the vm.

partially adresses: https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/issues/449

title: Update fuel-asm to 0.6 and fuel-tx to 0.14
fix block height when performing tx validation
body:
The VM was passing the default block height to tx validation before it was set. 

This PR updates the init logic to use the height passed in to the init function instead of relying on when the block height is set on the interpreter.

fixes: https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/issues/432

title: Remove unimplemented SLDC opcode
body:
This is a non-breaking change, but prepares for the next release of fuel-asm which doesn't have SLDC anymore.

Closes #143

title: Add dynamic jump opcodes JMP and JNE
body:
Closes #146 

~~Blocked by https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-asm/pull/75~~

~~Waiting for a new fuel-asm release, which in turn is waiting for https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-vm/issues/141 and https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-asm/issues/72~~

title: Set $rA to zero on EXP/EXPI overflow
body: Fixes https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-vm/issues/142

title: Add gas factor to gas cost and refund calculation
body:
Related issue: https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-tx/pull/141
Closes https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-specs/issues/342

title: Update VM memory for receipts root after append
body:
The VM memory section for the receipts root was updated only after the
script execution.

It is desirable to have it updated on the fly so the scripts can consume
the generated receipts root.

Closes #125

title: Update instruction executors to not dupl code
body:
The instruction executors are duplicated into different implementations
that either support the interpreter storage or don't. The latter is used
for predicate verification since contract opcodes, the only ones that
performs storage calls, aren't allowed.

This duplication will lead to harder long-term maintenance and should be
avoided.

The alternative introduced in this PR is to have a concrete storage
implementation that will deny any storage call, and introduce a check
for each instruction to evaluate if its predicate verification and if
the opcode is allowed for predicates.

This is sub-optimal because we introduce an extra branching per VM
cycle, but it can easily be refactored later to perform a couple of
bitwise operations after fuel-asm #68 is done.

Closes #133

title: Improve hygiene of `script_with_data_offset!`
body:
- Fix hygiene of script_with_data_offset so that no other imports are externally required.
- Fullly re-export all fuel-* prelude deps to simplify downstream dep management.

title: bump to v0.11.1
body: to release #134

title: make instruction executors accessible
body: This minor issue is preventing predicates from being integrated into fuel-core. The instruction executors need to be public in order to use the public apis for executing individual instructions when debugging.

title: Add consensus params to the vm for tx validation
body: continuation of https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-tx/issues/114

title: Duplicate revert receipt fix
body:
fixes: #126 

Expected Behavior:
The expected behavior for a revert is to immediately cease execution of opcodes, and only include one revert receipt.

Actual Behavior:
When a contract call reverted, the VM appended two revert receipts.

Summary:
The root cause is that while `run_call` correctly returned a revert state, this result was then discarded by the parent stack and not propagated. Since revert doesn't increase $pc, the same opcodes would run again on the parent stack (callee) causing the receipt to be appended twice.

The fix simply checks the result of `call` and returns with the Revert state if needed.

title: Update tx input predicate to new struct
Capture overflow value instead of overflow state into `$of`
body:
fixes: https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-vm/issues/121

Uses u128 math for all the instructions that need to treat the overflow register as the high bits of a u128. This will unblock the stdlib impl of u128 types.

This includes:

- add
- addi
- mul
- muli
- sll
- slli
- srl
- srli
- sub
- subi

The wording of the specs was somewhat confusing for srl & srli, since a logical shift right can't underflow. However, the specs describe the same `$of` behavior as other opcodes which do have under/overflow.

title: Profiler fixes
body:
Currently the data produced by the profiler cannot be serialized to JSON using Serde, as the data model requires object keys to be strings. Rust doesn't detect this at compile time, and the data was already usable in most binary formats like bincode. This PR makes it possible to serialize the data as JSON, but unfortunately Serde doesn't allow different formats for binary files, so this also increases size of bincode-encoded profile files.

This PR also adds `Send + Sync` trait bounds to the profile receiver, so that it can be used in multithreaded contexts, like in `async` functions.

title: cargo test with serde added to CI
body: closes #116

title: Update serde features to new schema
Cleanup todo for reverts
body: Removed a todo that was already implemented in another method (post_execution::finalize_outputs)

title: Implement unsafe and wrapping ALU flags
Bump fuel-asm to add JNZI. Implement JNZI in VM.
body: Fixes #107

title: update vm to use newer ScriptExecutionResult
body:
- Update to fuel-tx 0.8
- Use ScriptExecutionResult instead of InstructionResult in backtraces
  - note: we still have access to the `pc` and `is` via the cloned register values on backtrace and don't need instruction result to obtain these values.

title: remove VmValidationError type, use fuel-tx ValidationError instead
body: closes: #101

title: Implement MOVI opcode
body:
Implement MOVI opcode and replace non-idiomatic usages of `ADDI r 0 imm`.

This unblocks support for transactions with 255 inputs, since their script data offsets are now too large to fit in an ADDI imm12.

blocked by: https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-asm/pull/53

title: 0.5.1 version bump
body: for releasing the contract call opcode fixes

title: Address missing functionality in call opcode
body: There were several blocking todo's preventing contract calls from working properly, this PR should address all of them.

title: Variable output bugfix
body:
Variable outputs need to be updated directly on the serialized transaction representation in VM memory for IVG purposes. However, there was a bug when writing the variable output changes such that the wrong offset was used, potentially overwriting freebalances.

This PR also makes change outputs consistent between the serialized tx and ref tx. Since if the serialized tx matches the VM referenced tx after post-execution, the tx won't need to be recloned and serialized later in the client for merkleizing.

title: Single-stepping support for the debugger
body:
Adds single-stepping support. When enabled, a pseudo-breakpoint is triggered before each instruction. This could be achieved by simply adding a breakpoint for each instruction manually, which wouldn't require any code changes here. However, this approach is easier to use, and has a smaller performance impact.

Also makes `Interpreter::transaction()` public as accessing it after iterating breakpoints isn't possible with the current API. My understanding is that making it public doesn't have any soundness implications.

title: Bump to v0.5.0
body: Depends on #86

title: Bump fuel-tx to v0.6 and fuel-types to v0.3.
bump fuel-vm to release patch for gm opcode
Fix GM opcode for returning the opposite result
body:
GM was returning the opposite of what it should've when checking if the caller was external. Instead of setting rA = true when the caller was external, we set rA = true when the caller was internal.

fixes: https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-vm/issues/83

title: Implement Create Tx Storage Slot Initialization
body:
This PR updates the VM to initialize contract state when processing a create tx if initial storage values are provided.

closes #77

title: Change Outputs + `TR` + `TRO`
body:
This PR updates `fuel-vm` to mutate the outputs of the processed transaction according to the specs. It also implements the opcodes `TR` and `TRO`.

- Unused gas is refunded into the base asset change output
- Change is appropriately adjusted based on coin and withdrawal outputs
- `TRO` deducts from the input amount / change output in an external context
- `TR` deducts from input amount / change amount in an external context
- Variable outputs are correctly set in both internal and external contexts when using `TRO`
  - The serialized tx in VM is updated
  - The referenced tx returned in the VM state transition object also includes the variable output updates
 

closes #54

title: Remove unused constant for contract size.
body: Not used, `CONTRACT_MAX_SIZE` was used instead.

title: Remove cargo git fetch from CI
Fix license SPDX identifier and bump to v0.1.1
Code coverge profiling
body: Adds per-instruction code coverge profiling, i.e. keeps track of all executed addresses

title: make registers and memory public
body: Access to these are needed for remote debugging

title: Support new log data field
body: The data field was added to RETD and LOGD receipts in `fuel-types`, this PR actually sets the new fields from the VM

title: Add `Opcode::BAL` implementation
body:
The opcode implementation brings the ability to inspect the balance of a
given color+contract tuple.

This allows the test case `mint_burn` to be moved to the integrated
scope since before this opcode, there was no way to fetch the balance of
the tuple without inspecting the internals of the interpreter.

Follows FuelLabs/fuel-specs#226

title: Add `Receipt::ScriptReturn` to `run_program`
body:
When a script is executed, it should return a receipt with its status
and used gas.

However, if there is a halt-error defined in
`InterpreterError::is_panic`, then the VM should be interrupted, no gas
should be consumed, and no new state/receipt should be returned.

title: Update contract id to use celestia specs BMT
body:
The binary merkle tree of the specs points to the one specified in
celestia-specs. They are protected against second-preimage attacks by
prefixing the inputs with 0x00 for leaves, or 0x01 for nodes.

This commit introduces this protection.

Also, as window of opportunity, the deprecated since 1.56 `use TryFrom`
was removed from the code.

Closes #49

title: Add gas profiling
body:
This PR introduces gas profiling in the VM, and also adds a simple framework for adding more profiling features in the future, e.g. code coverage or memory allocations. It doesn't yet include any tooling to use profiling data, but it's expected to be combined later with source-mapping to provide statistics on source code level as well.

Closes #46

title: Add `Backtrace` error struct
body:
Backtrace will be responsible to provide the required data to debug the
souce of an error.

Since its creation cost isn't cheap, it will not be provided by default.
The user will need to create a backtrace instance from the VM instance
that generated the error, combined with the error variant itself.

title: Add MCPI opcode
body: Closes #43

title: Refactor `execute` to parse Word in pairs
body:
With the introduction of `fuel_asm::Instruction`, we can now parse pairs
of instructions from words, reducing the execution overhead compared to
when we parse the opcodes individually from half-words.

This allows also the static gas calculation for most opcodes. For the
ones with variable cost (e.g. MCL), a monad concept was introduced.

The variable gas cost opcodes should be described in `term + F(x)` form,
where `term` is the constant part and `F` should take `GasUnit` to
define a simplified arithmetic operation with the runtime register
value.

title: Implement LDC instruction
body: Closes #23

title: Add `MemoryClient`
body:
This struct should emulate a functional client and take iterators of
`Transaction`s to mutate a storage.

This implementation should define the commit/revert/persist/rollback
strategy depending on the receipts returned by the VM.

title: Add implementation for `GM` opcode
body:
The variants of the get metadata function must be specified as enum so
the consumers of this library can use it as immediate value of the `GM`
opcode without acessing the internal value of the constant
representation.

title: Add `RVRT` instruction implementation
body: `RVRT` halts the execution of the VM and revert the storage changes.

title: Refactor interpreter instructions to return Result
body:
Interpreter instructions should have uniform execution. Since `inc_pc`
is fallible - it can overflow the vm memory - then every instruction is
fallible with the exception of `RET` under specific circumstances.

A single exception is not a good reason to have divergent
implementations for all the opcodes.

As TODO optimization, the half-word should parsed only once and
gas/execution match statement should be simplified and executed only
once as well. Having an uniform implementation for all opcodes will
facilitate that optimization.

title: Add repo keys
body: Merges into #24.

title: Add `fuel-types` and `fuel-storage` as deps
body:
`fuel-data` was split into `fuel-types` and `fuel-storage` to avoid
mixing VM/infrastructure requirements with generic data trait
definitions.

title: Add `fuel-data` as dependency
body:
* Remove `Storage` and `MerkleStorage` implementations
* Use `Cow` for storage read operations
* Implement default trait methods for common storage operations
